column1: Crafty had studied the ways of the human race for many years. In his view man was created for the benefit of rats. He had known men who were almost as sly as rats; but on the whole he looked upon them as inferior beings.Simple
column3: had also a great contempt for men and women. He often boasted that he got his board and lodging all at their expense. But he did not know half as much as he thought he did; and many a time he had been kept from getting into a scrape by his good friend Crafty.One night
column5: Crafty and Simple started out together to see what they could find. Having poked into every corner of Farmer Rural's cellar
column6: without getting any thing better than raw potatoes
column7: they made their way up stairs.
